titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Clemmons, Frank Kennady, and William Cason, Indictment
CWG6885

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Grant Circuit Court
Commonwealth of Kentucky Pltff
against
William Clemmons Frank Kennady and William Cason Defts
Indictment for Felony
The Grand jury of Grant County in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse William Clemmons Frank Kennady & William Cason of the offense of --

Committed as follows viz The said William Clemmons Frank Kennady & W Cason in the County afsd on the day of October 1862 did feloniously take and Carry away one Gun the propetty of James Webb of the value of more than four Dollars, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

E H Smith
Commonwealths Atty
protem

Witness for Comth
L C Webb

a Copy att
N H Jeffers C G C C
By Thos A. Franklin D, C,
